description:
As a new user, I want to register using my email and verify it with a One-Time Password (OTP) so that I can create a secure account without needing a traditional password.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful registration, invalid email, OTP expiration, and resend OTP functionality. Acceptance criteria include email validation, 6-digit OTP generation with 10-minute expiry, rate limiting (max 3 OTPs per 15 minutes), and profile/reward record creation.

As a returning user, I want to sign in using my email and an OTP so that I can access my account securely without remembering a password.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful sign-in, unregistered email, invalid OTP, expired OTP, and rate limiting. Acceptance criteria include OTP generation, verification within 10 minutes, max 5 failed attempts before lockout, and JWT token generation.

As a user, I want to view and edit my profile information so that I can keep my account details up to date.

Gherkin scenarios cover viewing profile, successful profile updates, and invalid data submission. Acceptance criteria include viewing/editing first name, last name, mobile number, birthday, address fields, and email validation.

As a user, I want to upload a custom avatar image so that I can personalize my profile.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful upload, invalid file type/size, and avatar deletion. Acceptance criteria include JPG/PNG/WebP support, 5MB size limit, automatic resizing to 512x512px, secure Supabase storage with RLS policies, and default avatar fallback.

As a system administrator, I want to validate email addresses during registration so that we maintain a clean user database and prevent fraudulent accounts.

Gherkin scenarios cover valid email, invalid format, disposable email blocking, and typo suggestions. Acceptance criteria include RFC 5322 validation, disposable domain blocking, typo detection (e.g., gmial.com â†’ gmail.com), and error messaging.

As a demo user, I want to explore the app without providing an email so that I can evaluate features before committing to registration.

Gherkin scenarios cover demo session initiation, feature access, data persistence limits, and conversion to full account. Acceptance criteria include session-based authentication, 7-day session expiry, limited cart persistence, and upgrade prompts at checkout.

As a user, I want to set up Passkey authentication (WebAuthn) so that I can log in securely using Face ID, Touch ID, or Windows Hello.

Gherkin scenarios cover Passkey registration, successful login, fallback to OTP, and Passkey management. Acceptance criteria include WebAuthn API integration, device-specific credential storage, fallback to OTP, and multiple Passkey support.

summary: SMS OTP as Alternative to Email OTP
description:
As a user, I want to receive OTPs via SMS so that I can authenticate using my phone number instead of email.

Gherkin scenarios cover SMS OTP for sign-in/registration, invalid phone numbers, and carrier delivery failures. Acceptance criteria include E.164 phone number format, Twilio/AWS SNS integration, 6-digit OTP with 10-minute expiry, and rate limiting (max 3 SMS per 15 minutes).

As a user, I want to sign in using my Google account so that I can access the app quickly without creating a new account.

Gherkin scenarios cover first-time Google sign-in with profile creation and returning user sign-in. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Google provider integration, automatic profile creation with Google data, consent screen for permissions, and secure token handling.

As an iOS user, I want to sign in using my Apple ID so that I can authenticate securely with minimal data sharing.

Gherkin scenarios cover Apple sign-in, 'Hide My Email' feature handling, and returning user flow. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Apple provider integration, email privacy support, automatic profile creation, and iOS/macOS native prompts.

As a user, I want to sign in using my Facebook account so that I can connect my social profile and streamline registration.

Gherkin scenarios cover Facebook sign-in and permission handling. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Facebook provider integration, profile data retrieval (name, email, profile picture), permission request flow, and secure token handling.

As a user, I want to sign in using my Microsoft account so that I can use my work or personal Microsoft credentials.

Gherkin scenarios cover Microsoft sign-in and organizational account handling. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Microsoft provider integration, Azure AD support, automatic profile creation, and organizational account compatibility.

As a user, I want a single, intuitive sign-in screen that offers all authentication methods so that I can choose my preferred login option easily.

Gherkin scenarios cover authentication options display, method switching, and responsive design. Acceptance criteria include single sign-in/sign-up page, method tabs (Email OTP, SMS OTP, Passkey, Social), visual consistency, mobile responsiveness, and clear error messaging.

As a user with multiple authentication methods, I want to link and manage all my sign-in options so that I can access my account through any preferred method.

Gherkin scenarios cover linking accounts, duplicate email handling, unlinking methods, and primary method designation. Acceptance criteria include account linking UI in profile settings, duplicate email detection, minimum one authentication method requirement, and primary method designation.

As a product manager, I want to track authentication method usage and success rates so that I can optimize the authentication experience.

Acceptance criteria include tracking authentication attempts by method, success/failure rates, OAuth provider usage, Passkey adoption rate, and session duration metrics with admin dashboard visualization.

summary: Fallback and Error Handling for Authentication
description:
As a user, I want clear guidance and fallback options when authentication fails so that I can successfully access my account.

Gherkin scenarios cover OAuth provider unavailability, Passkey failure with fallback, SMS delivery failure with email fallback, and network error handling. Acceptance criteria include graceful OAuth provider failure handling, automatic fallback mechanisms, clear error messages, retry logic with exponential backoff, and help center links.

summary: Search for Venues by Name or Location
description:
As a user, I want to search for venues by name or location so that I can quickly find a specific place to order from.

Gherkin scenarios cover search by venue name, search by city/address, partial name matching, and no results handling. Acceptance criteria include text input search, partial/fuzzy matching, city/state/ZIP search support, real-time search results, and minimum 2-character input.

summary: Use Current Location to Find Nearby Venues
description:
As a user, I want to use my current GPS location to find nearby venues so that I can discover places close to me.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful location access, location permission denial, and distance-based sorting. Acceptance criteria include 'Near Me' button, Geolocation API usage, distance calculation (haversine formula), sort by proximity, permission handling, and fallback to manual search.

summary: Display Venue Information in Search Results
description:
As a user, I want to see key venue information in search results so that I can make an informed decision about which venue to select.

Gherkin scenarios cover search result display with details and distance display for location-based search. Acceptance criteria include venue name, address, distance, rating, hours, and price range display with responsive card layout.

summary: Select a Venue to Start Shopping
description:
As a user, I want to explicitly select a venue from search results so that I can browse its menu and place orders.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful venue selection and viewing venue menu. Acceptance criteria include clickable venue cards, confirmation of selection, redirect to venue menu, venue context persistence, and visual selected state indicator.

summary: View Currently Selected Venue While Browsing
description:
As a user, I want to see which venue I've selected while browsing the menu so that I know where my order will be placed.

Gherkin scenarios cover persistent venue indicator display, venue details modal, and navigation menu venue display. Acceptance criteria include persistent header indicator, venue name/address display, venue detail modal access, and visual prominence.

As a user, I want to switch to a different venue so that I can explore other options without losing my place.

Gherkin scenarios cover venue switching with empty cart, confirmation when cart has items, and cart clearing on confirmation. Acceptance criteria include 'Change Venue' button, cart warning modal, cart clearing on confirmation, and preservation of user/session state.

As a user, I want to browse products organized by category so that I can easily find the type of drink or food I'm looking for.

Gherkin scenarios cover category navigation, filtering, and 'All Products' view. Acceptance criteria include category selector UI, dynamic filtering, product counts per category, and responsive grid layout.

As a user, I want to see featured products so that I can discover popular or promotional items quickly.

Gherkin scenarios cover featured section display and featured products across categories. Acceptance criteria include featured section on menu page, visual distinction (badges/highlights), venue-specific featured items, and manual/automatic curation.

As a user, I want to view detailed information about a product so that I can make an informed purchasing decision.

Gherkin scenarios cover product detail modal display and allergy information display. Acceptance criteria include product modal with name, image, description, price, alcohol content, volume, allergy info, tags, 'Add to Cart' button, and accessibility support.

summary: Search for Products by Name or Keyword
description:
As a user, I want to search for products by name or keyword so that I can quickly find specific items.

Gherkin scenarios cover keyword search, partial matching, and no results handling. Acceptance criteria include search bar on menu page, real-time results, partial/fuzzy matching, search across name/description/tags, minimum 2-character input, and 'no results' messaging.

summary: Filter Products by Category or Tag
description:
As a user, I want to filter products by category or tag so that I can narrow down my options.

Gherkin scenarios cover category filtering, tag filtering, and filter clearing. Acceptance criteria include category/tag filter UI, dynamic tag list, single category + multiple tags, real-time filtering, and active filter display with clear option.

As a user, I want to apply multiple filters at once so that I can refine my product search to match my specific preferences.

Gherkin scenarios cover combining category and tag filters and cumulative filtering. Acceptance criteria include multiple tag selection, AND logic for filters, filter count badge, and results update on each filter change.

As a user, I want to sort products by price so that I can find items within my budget.

Gherkin scenarios cover sort by price ascending and descending. Acceptance criteria include sort dropdown with price low-to-high/high-to-low options, persistent sort across category changes, and combination with search/filter.

summary: Sort Products by Popularity or Name
description:
As a user, I want to sort products by popularity or alphabetically so that I can discover trending items or find products easily.

Gherkin scenarios cover sort by popularity and alphabetical sort. Acceptance criteria include sort options for popularity (view/order count), A-Z/Z-A alphabetical sort, default sort by popularity or featured status, and persistent sort preference.

summary: View Search Results with Relevance Ranking
description:
As a user, I want search results ranked by relevance so that the most matching products appear first.

Acceptance criteria include relevance algorithm (exact match > partial match > tag match), keyword highlighting in results, and search analytics tracking.

summary: Age Verification Modal on First Visit
description:
As a user, I want to verify my age when I first visit the app so that I can confirm I'm legally allowed to purchase alcohol.

Gherkin scenarios cover first-time modal display, verification completion, and modal persistence after verification. Acceptance criteria include modal display on first visit, blocking access until verified, session persistence, and 'Remember Me' option for 30-day cookie.

summary: Collect and Validate Date of Birth
description:
As a user, I want to enter my date of birth so that the system can verify I meet the legal drinking age.

Gherkin scenarios cover valid DOB entry for users 21+, underage user blocking (under 21), future date rejection, and invalid date format handling. Acceptance criteria include DOB input field (MM/DD/YYYY), client-side validation, legal age calculation (21+ in US), clear error messages, and DOB storage in profiles table.

As a system administrator, I want the app to verify legal drinking age based on the user's location so that we comply with regional alcohol laws.

Gherkin scenarios cover age verification in US (21+) and international age verification (18+ in UK). Acceptance criteria include region-based age rules (US: 21, UK/EU: 18, etc.), IP-based or manual region selection, age verification pass/fail, and support for 50 US states + international markets.

As a verified user, I want my age verification status to persist across sessions so that I don't have to verify my age every time I visit.

Gherkin scenarios cover persistent verification across sessions and verification expiration after 30 days. Acceptance criteria include localStorage/cookie storage, 30-day expiration, re-verification prompt on expiry, and logout-based clearing.

As a system administrator, I want users to re-verify their age for high-risk actions so that we maintain compliance and prevent account sharing.

Gherkin scenarios cover re-verification at checkout and re-verification after suspicious activity. Acceptance criteria include re-verification triggers (checkout, large orders, account changes, suspicious activity), simplified re-verification (confirmation + DOB last 4 digits), and security audit logging.

As a system administrator, I want to block underage users from accessing the app so that we comply with legal requirements.

Gherkin scenarios cover blocking and redirect for underage users and permanent block on repeated attempts. Acceptance criteria include access block for underage users, redirect to informational page, 24-hour block after 3 failed attempts, and audit logging.

As a user, I want to view my current rewards points balance so that I know how many points I have available to redeem.

Gherkin scenarios cover points balance display and reflection of earned/redeemed points. Acceptance criteria include prominent points display in Rewards section, real-time updates, breakdown of available/pending/lifetime points, and display in profile/account dashboard.

As a user, I want to see my current loyalty tier and progress toward the next tier so that I understand my status and benefits.

Gherkin scenarios cover current tier display and progress visualization. Acceptance criteria include tier name and level display, progress bar to next tier, points needed display, tier benefits list, and tier badge/icon.

summary: Redeem Rewards for Discounts or Free Items
description:
As a user, I want to redeem my points for rewards so that I can get discounts or free items.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful redemption, insufficient points handling, and reward application at checkout. Acceptance criteria include available rewards catalog, points cost display, one-click redemption, instant confirmation, reward coupon generation, and expiration tracking.

As a user, I want to earn points on every purchase so that I can accumulate rewards for future use.

Gherkin scenarios cover points earning on order completion and bonus points for high-value orders. Acceptance criteria include automatic points award (1 point per $1 spent), bonus multipliers (tier-based, promotions), real-time points crediting, and transaction notifications.

As a user, I want to view my points transaction history so that I can track how I've earned and spent points.

Gherkin scenarios cover transaction history display and filtering by type. Acceptance criteria include chronological transaction list, earn/redeem indicators, points amount, transaction date, reason/description, filtering by type (earned, redeemed, expired), and pagination.

As a user, I want to refer friends to the app and earn bonus points when they sign up so that I can increase my rewards balance.

Gherkin scenarios cover unique referral code generation and points earning on successful referral. Acceptance criteria include unique referral code per user, shareable referral link, points award when referred user signs up and makes first purchase, referral tracking dashboard, and bonus points for both referrer and referee.

As a user, I want to add products to my cart so that I can collect multiple items before checking out.

Gherkin scenarios cover adding items, quantity selection, and cart icon update. Acceptance criteria include 'Add to Cart' button, default quantity of 1, quantity selector (1-10+), real-time cart icon update, success confirmation, and duplicate item handling (increase quantity).

As a user, I want to remove items from my cart so that I can adjust my order before checkout.

Gherkin scenarios cover item removal and cart emptying. Acceptance criteria include 'Remove' button per item, confirmation prompt, cart total update, cart icon update, and empty cart state handling.

As a user, I want to adjust the quantity of items in my cart so that I can order the exact amount I need.

Gherkin scenarios cover quantity increase/decrease and maximum quantity limit. Acceptance criteria include +/- buttons or input field, real-time price update, minimum quantity of 1, maximum quantity based on availability, and quantity change validation.

As a user, I want to view a summary of my cart so that I can review my order before checkout.

Gherkin scenarios cover cart summary display and cart updates. Acceptance criteria include item list with name/price/quantity, subtotal calculation, applied discounts, taxes, fees, grand total, and 'Proceed to Checkout' button.

As a user, I want to apply discount codes to my cart so that I can save money on my order.

Gherkin scenarios cover valid code application and invalid code handling. Acceptance criteria include discount code input field, real-time validation, discount amount/percentage display, subtotal update, code expiration check, and one code per order limit.

As a user, I want to apply promotional codes during checkout so that I can take advantage of special offers.

Gherkin scenarios cover promo code application and cart total update. Acceptance criteria include promo code input field, real-time validation, promo discount display, eligibility checks (minimum order, product restrictions), and error messaging for invalid/expired codes.

As a user, I want my cart to be saved across sessions so that I don't lose my items if I leave the app.

Gherkin scenarios cover cart persistence and cart restoration. Acceptance criteria include localStorage/backend storage, cart restoration on login, session-based cart for guests, cart expiration after 7 days, and cart clearing on logout (optional).

As a user, I want to review my order details before finalizing so that I can ensure everything is correct.

Gherkin scenarios cover order review page and editing before checkout. Acceptance criteria include order summary display (items, quantities, prices), subtotal, taxes, fees, grand total, delivery/pickup method, delivery address, payment method, special instructions, and 'Edit' option for each section.

As a user, I want to choose between delivery and pickup so that I can receive my order in my preferred way.

Gherkin scenarios cover delivery selection with address input and pickup selection. Acceptance criteria include delivery/pickup toggle, delivery address input (autocomplete), pickup location display, delivery fee calculation, estimated delivery/pickup time, and address validation.

As a user, I want to enter my payment details securely so that I can complete my purchase safely.

Gherkin scenarios cover card payment entry and payment method validation. Acceptance criteria include PCI-compliant payment form, credit/debit card support, CVV/expiry validation, saved payment method option, 3D Secure (SCA), and Stripe integration.

As a user, I want to receive order confirmation after checkout so that I know my order was successful.

Gherkin scenarios cover confirmation page display and email confirmation. Acceptance criteria include confirmation page with order number, order summary, estimated time, payment confirmation, tracking link, and email/SMS confirmation.

summary: Save Payment Method for Future Use
description:
As a user, I want to save my payment method so that I can checkout faster in the future.

Gherkin scenarios cover saving card during checkout and using saved card. Acceptance criteria include 'Save payment method' checkbox, secure tokenization (Stripe), payment method list in profile, default payment option, and card deletion.

As a user, I want to apply redeemed rewards during checkout so that I can use my earned benefits.

Gherkin scenarios cover reward application and discount reflection. Acceptance criteria include redeemed rewards display, automatic discount application, reward expiration check, one reward per order (or multiple if allowed), and reward redemption confirmation.

As a guest, I want to checkout without creating an account so that I can complete my order quickly.

Gherkin scenarios cover guest checkout flow and account creation prompt. Acceptance criteria include guest checkout option, email/phone input, order tracking via email/order number, 'Create account' prompt post-checkout, and order history access (limited).

As a user, I want to receive order confirmation via email or SMS so that I have a record of my purchase.

Gherkin scenarios cover email confirmation and SMS confirmation. Acceptance criteria include confirmation email with order details, SMS notification with order number and ETA, confirmation sent within 1 minute, and unsubscribe option.

As a user, I want to view a list of all my past orders so that I can easily keep track of my purchases and spending.

Gherkin scenarios cover viewing order history. Acceptance criteria include order history section, list of past orders, order date/number/total display, most recent orders first, and order status display.

As a user, I want to view detailed information about each order so that I can see exactly what I purchased.

Gherkin scenarios cover order detail page display. Acceptance criteria include order detail page, order number, date, status, itemized list (name, quantity, price), subtotal, taxes, fees, grand total, delivery/pickup method, delivery address, payment method, and special instructions.

As a user, I want to track my order status in real-time so that I know when my order will be ready.

Gherkin scenarios cover real-time status updates and status notifications. Acceptance criteria include order status display (received, preparing, ready, completed, delivered), real-time updates (polling/WebSocket), status timeline/progress bar, ETA display, and push/SMS notifications on status change.

As a user, I want to quickly reorder from my past orders so that I can save time.

Gherkin scenarios cover reorder button and handling unavailable items. Acceptance criteria include 'Reorder' button on past orders, one-click add to cart, unavailable item notification, and cart summary display.

As a user, I want to filter and sort my order history so that I can find specific orders easily.

Gherkin scenarios cover filtering by date range and sorting. Acceptance criteria include filter by date range, filter by status, filter by venue, sort by date (newest/oldest), sort by amount (high/low), and search by order number/product.

As a user, I want to cancel my order if needed so that I can avoid receiving an unwanted order.

Gherkin scenarios cover order cancellation and cancellation deadline. Acceptance criteria include 'Cancel Order' button, cancellation confirmation modal, cancellation reason input, cancellation deadline (e.g., 5 minutes after order), refund processing, and cancellation notification.
Phone)
priority:
As a user, I want to update my email and phone number so that my contact information stays current.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful contact update and email/phone verification. Acceptance criteria include editable email/phone fields, OTP verification for changes, duplicate email/phone prevention, and confirmation message.

description:
As a user, I want to update my birthday and gender so that my profile reflects accurate information.

Gherkin scenarios cover birthday/gender update and privacy controls. Acceptance criteria include editable DOB field (MM/DD/YYYY), gender dropdown/free text, privacy settings (public, private, friends-only), and validation (no future dates).
Edit
parent:
As a user, I want to manage multiple addresses so that I can easily select delivery locations.

Gherkin scenarios cover adding address and deleting address. Acceptance criteria include address list display, 'Add Address' button, address form (street, city, state, ZIP), Google Places autocomplete, set default address, edit/delete options, and address validation.

description:
As a user, I want to control my notification settings so that I only receive alerts I want.

Gherkin scenarios cover toggling notifications and granular controls. Acceptance criteria include notification preference toggles (email, SMS, push), granular controls (order updates, promotions, reminders, rewards), 'Mute All' option, and instant save on toggle.

As a user, I want to opt in or out of marketing communications so that I control what promotional content I receive.

Gherkin scenarios cover marketing opt-out and unsubscribe link. Acceptance criteria include marketing preference toggles (email newsletters, SMS promos, partner offers), granular controls, one-click unsubscribe link in emails, and GDPR/CAN-SPAM compliance.
Tracking)
priority:
As a user, I want to control my privacy settings so that I can decide how my data is used.

Gherkin scenarios cover data sharing controls and ad personalization. Acceptance criteria include privacy settings page, data sharing toggles (analytics, personalized ads, third-party partners), ad tracking opt-out, clear privacy explanations, and instant save on toggle.

description:
As a user, I want to manage my consents so that I have control over how my data is used.

Gherkin scenarios cover consent management and consent history. Acceptance criteria include consent management page, granular consent toggles (cookies, location, biometrics, email, SMS), consent timestamp logging, consent history view, and integration with cookie consent banner.

As a system administrator, I want profile updates to be validated so that we maintain data integrity.

Acceptance criteria include client-side validation (email format, phone format, required fields), server-side validation, real-time error messages, validation on blur/submit, and character limits.

As a user, I want to add new payment methods securely so that I can easily make purchases without re-entering details every time.

Gherkin scenarios cover adding credit card and invalid card handling. Acceptance criteria include 'Add Payment Method' button, Stripe Elements integration, card detail input (number, expiry, CVC, name), real-time validation, PCI compliance, and saved card display.

As a user, I want to set a default payment method so that checkout is faster.

Gherkin scenarios cover setting default card and default card usage. Acceptance criteria include 'Set as Default' toggle per card, default card indicator, automatic selection at checkout, and ability to change default.

As a user, I want to update my payment details (e.g., expiry date) so that my saved methods remain valid.

Gherkin scenarios cover updating card details and invalid update handling. Acceptance criteria include 'Edit' button per card, editable fields (expiry, billing address), Stripe API update call, validation, and confirmation message.

As a user, I want to view a history of my payments so that I can track my transactions and identify any discrepancies.

Gherkin scenarios cover viewing payment history and transaction details. Acceptance criteria include 'Payment History' section, chronological transaction list, transaction details (date, amount, order link), filter by date range/amount, and sort options.

As a system administrator, I want to ensure PCI DSS compliance so that customer payment data is secure.

Acceptance criteria include Stripe PCI Level 1 compliance, no raw card data storage, tokenized card storage, HTTPS enforcement, security audit logging, and annual PCI compliance review.

As a user, I want to view my spending patterns over time (e.g., weekly, monthly) so I can understand my consumption habits and manage my budget effectively.

Gherkin scenarios cover viewing spending patterns and category filtering. Acceptance criteria include spending graph (line/bar chart), time period selection (week, month, year), total spending display, category filtering, and trend indicators.

As a user, I want to see how often I order so I can understand my usage patterns.

Gherkin scenarios cover order frequency metrics. Acceptance criteria include order frequency display (orders per week/month), frequency trend chart, average order value, peak order times, and comparison to previous periods.

summary: View Loyalty Points Earned and Redeemed
description:
As a user, I want to see a breakdown of points I've earned and redeemed so I can track my rewards activity.

Gherkin scenarios cover points breakdown and tier progression. Acceptance criteria include points earned/redeemed chart, monthly/yearly breakdown, top earning activities, redemption history, and tier progression timeline.

As a user, I want to receive personalized insights so I can make better decisions about my orders.

Gherkin scenarios cover personalized insights and actionable recommendations. Acceptance criteria include AI-generated insights (e.g., 'You order most on Fridays'), spending/budget tips, product recommendations, rewards optimization tips, and insight refresh frequency.
PDF)
priority:
As a user, I want to export my dashboard data so I can analyze it offline or share it.

Gherkin scenarios cover CSV export and PDF export. Acceptance criteria include 'Export' button, CSV format (spending, orders, points), PDF format (charts and summaries), date range selection, and email delivery option.

description:
As a user, I want to compare my analytics across different time periods so I can see how my habits have changed.

Gherkin scenarios cover period comparison and metric comparison. Acceptance criteria include period selector (week vs. week, month vs. month, year vs. year), comparison charts (side-by-side, overlay), percentage change display, and comparison insights.
Touch ID)
priority:
As a user, I want to enable biometric authentication so I can log in quickly and securely using Face ID or Touch ID.

Gherkin scenarios cover biometric setup, successful login, and fallback to password. Acceptance criteria include biometric setup UI, WebAuthn/Passkey integration, Face ID/Touch ID support, fingerprint support, fallback to OTP, and device-specific enrollment.

description:
As a user, I want to disable biometric authentication so I can switch back to password-based login if needed.

Gherkin scenarios cover disabling biometrics and subsequent password login. Acceptance criteria include 'Disable Biometrics' button, confirmation prompt, credential removal, fallback to OTP, and confirmation message.

summary: Manage Biometric Preferences (When to Use Biometrics)
description:
As a user, I want to choose when biometric authentication is required so I can balance security and convenience.

Gherkin scenarios cover biometric trigger settings and preference enforcement. Acceptance criteria include biometric preference settings (login only, transactions, profile changes), toggle controls, preference persistence, and instant save.

summary: Fallback to Password/OTP if Biometrics Fail
description:
As a user, I want to use my password or OTP if biometric authentication fails so I'm not locked out.

Gherkin scenarios cover biometric failure and fallback. Acceptance criteria include automatic fallback on biometric failure (3 attempts), 'Use Password/OTP' option, clear error messages, and seamless fallback flow.

As a user, I want to register multiple biometric credentials (e.g., two fingerprints) so I have backup authentication options.

Gherkin scenarios cover multiple credential registration and usage. Acceptance criteria include support for multiple fingerprints, multiple Face ID profiles, credential management UI, and label/name for each credential.

As a user, I want to view a log of biometric authentication attempts so I can monitor my account security.

Gherkin scenarios cover audit log display and suspicious activity alerts. Acceptance criteria include audit log page, authentication attempt list (timestamp, device, success/failure), failed attempt alerts, and activity monitoring.

As a user, I want to see my estimated blood alcohol content (BAC) in real-time so I can monitor my alcohol consumption.

Gherkin scenarios cover BAC display and BAC updates. Acceptance criteria include BAC dashboard, real-time BAC calculation (Widmark formula), BAC level indicator (safe, caution, danger), last updated timestamp, and BAC trend chart.

As a user, I want to log drinks I consume so my BAC estimation is accurate.

Gherkin scenarios cover manual drink logging and automatic logging from orders. Acceptance criteria include 'Log Drink' button, drink details (type, volume, ABV), timestamp, automatic logging from completed orders, and drink history.

summary: Receive Safety Alerts Based on BAC Levels
description:
As a user, I want to receive alerts when my BAC is elevated so I can make safer decisions.

Gherkin scenarios cover BAC threshold alerts and alert acknowledgment. Acceptance criteria include safety alert thresholds (0.05%, 0.08%, 0.10%), push/SMS notifications, in-app alert modal, suggested actions (stop drinking, call ride, hydrate), and alert acknowledgment.

summary: Connect Wearable Devices for Biometric Monitoring
description:
As a user, I want to connect my wearable device so my health metrics (heart rate, etc.) are monitored during drinking.

Gherkin scenarios cover device connection and biometric data display. Acceptance criteria include wearable device integration (Apple Health, Google Fit, Fitbit), biometric data sync (heart rate, BP, O2), real-time health monitoring, and health alert triggers.

As a user, I want to see responsible drinking tips so I can consume alcohol more safely.

Gherkin scenarios cover tips display and personalized tips. Acceptance criteria include tips library (hydration, pacing, food), context-based tips (based on BAC, session duration), tip rotation, and 'Learn More' links.

As a user, I want to manually end my drinking session so my BAC tracking resets.

Gherkin scenarios cover session end and session summary. Acceptance criteria include 'End Session' button, session summary (total drinks, peak BAC, duration), BAC decay timeline, and session archiving.

As a user, I want to add my credit/debit card securely using Stripe so I can make purchases.

Gherkin scenarios cover adding card and invalid card handling. Acceptance criteria include Stripe Elements integration, card input (number, expiry, CVC, ZIP), real-time validation, PCI compliance, tokenized storage, and 3D Secure support.

As a user, I want to see all my saved payment methods so I can choose how to pay.

Gherkin scenarios cover payment method list display and card details. Acceptance criteria include payment method list, card display (last 4 digits, brand, expiry), default indicator, and 'Add New' button.

As a user, I want to remove a saved payment method so I can keep my account clean.

Gherkin scenarios cover card removal and default card removal. Acceptance criteria include 'Remove' button, confirmation prompt, Stripe PaymentMethod detach API, and update payment method list.

summary: Process Payment Securely via Stripe PaymentIntent
description:
As a system, I want to process payments securely using Stripe PaymentIntent so that transactions are reliable and PCI-compliant.

Gherkin scenarios cover successful payment and payment failure. Acceptance criteria include Stripe PaymentIntent creation, amount/currency specification, 3D Secure (SCA) handling, payment confirmation, webhook integration, and error handling.

As a user, I want clear guidance when my payment fails so I can resolve the issue.

Gherkin scenarios cover payment decline and retry logic. Acceptance criteria include payment failure error messages, decline reason display (insufficient funds, invalid card), retry option, alternative payment method prompt, and payment status tracking.

As a user, I want to receive refunds for canceled orders so my payment is returned.

Gherkin scenarios cover full refund and partial refund. Acceptance criteria include refund processing via Stripe Refund API, full/partial refund support, refund reason tracking, refund confirmation email, and refund status display.

summary: Manage Stripe Webhooks for Payment Events
description:
As a system administrator, I want to receive webhook events from Stripe so payment status is synchronized.

Acceptance criteria include webhook endpoint creation, event handling (payment_intent.succeeded, payment_intent.failed, charge.refunded), webhook signature verification, event logging, and retry mechanism for failed events.

As a user, I want to subscribe to a loyalty membership so I can receive ongoing benefits.

Gherkin scenarios cover subscription creation and subscription billing. Acceptance criteria include Stripe Subscription creation, recurring billing setup, subscription plan selection, billing cycle display, payment method requirement, and subscription management UI.

As a system administrator, I want to view payment analytics so I can monitor transaction performance.

Acceptance criteria include payment analytics dashboard, metrics (transaction volume, success rate, refund rate, average transaction value), date range filtering, payment method breakdown, and data export (CSV).

summary: Accept Cookie Consent on First Visit
description:
As a user, I want to accept or decline cookies so I control how my data is tracked.

Gherkin scenarios cover cookie consent acceptance and consent decline. Acceptance criteria include cookie consent banner on first visit, 'Accept All' and 'Reject All' buttons, granular cookie settings, consent persistence (localStorage/cookie), and banner dismissal.

As a user, I want to manage my cookie preferences so I can control what types of cookies are used.

Gherkin scenarios cover cookie preference updates and preference persistence. Acceptance criteria include cookie settings page, cookie categories (essential, analytics, marketing), toggle controls, preference saving, and 'Accept All'/'Reject All' options.

As a user, I want to export my personal data so I can review what information is stored about me.

Gherkin scenarios cover data export request and export file delivery. Acceptance criteria include 'Export Data' button in profile, data export format (JSON, CSV), export scope (profile, orders, payments, points), email delivery, and 30-day processing time.

summary: Request Data Deletion (Right to be Forgotten)
description:
As a user, I want to request deletion of my personal data so I can exercise my right to be forgotten.

Gherkin scenarios cover deletion request and account closure. Acceptance criteria include 'Delete My Data' option, confirmation with warning, 30-day grace period, account deactivation, data deletion after grace period, and email confirmation.

As a user, I want to view a log of security events on my account so I can monitor for suspicious activity.

Gherkin scenarios cover audit log display and suspicious activity alerts. Acceptance criteria include security audit log page, event list (login, profile change, payment method change, order placement), timestamp and IP address display, and suspicious activity notifications.

As a user, I want to control which partners can access my data so I can protect my privacy.

Gherkin scenarios cover data sharing consent toggles and consent withdrawal. Acceptance criteria include consent management page, partner list, data sharing toggles (analytics, personalized ads, third-party partners), consent timestamp logging, and instant save.

As a user, I want to view the privacy policy so I understand how my data is used.

Gherkin scenarios cover privacy policy display and acceptance requirement. Acceptance criteria include 'Privacy Policy' link in footer, policy display page, acceptance required on signup, policy version tracking, and update notifications.

As a user, I want to be notified when the privacy policy changes so I can review updates.

Gherkin scenarios cover policy change notification and re-consent requirement. Acceptance criteria include email notification on policy update, in-app notification, policy change summary, re-consent requirement, and policy version history.

As a user, I want to understand how long my data is retained so I know my privacy rights.

Acceptance criteria include data retention policy page, retention periods by data type (profile: indefinite, orders: 7 years, logs: 1 year), data deletion schedule, and clear explanations.

As a venue owner, I want to see the benefits of partnering so I can decide if I want to join.

Gherkin scenarios cover landing page display and benefits breakdown. Acceptance criteria include partnership landing page, benefits list (increased revenue, customer acquisition, marketing support, analytics), success stories/testimonials, and 'Get Started' CTA.

As a venue owner, I want to submit an inquiry to partner so I can start the onboarding process.

Gherkin scenarios cover inquiry submission and confirmation email. Acceptance criteria include partnership inquiry form, required fields (venue name, location, contact email, phone, venue type, description), form validation, confirmation email, and sales team notification.

As a venue owner, I want to view detailed information about the partnership program so I understand the terms and expectations.

Gherkin scenarios cover program details display and FAQ access. Acceptance criteria include program details page, terms and conditions, partnership tiers (if applicable), revenue sharing model, support resources, and FAQ section.

As a venue owner, I want to contact the sales team directly so I can ask questions before partnering.

Gherkin scenarios cover sales contact form and phone number display. Acceptance criteria include 'Contact Sales' form or email link, phone number display, sales team response time estimate, and inquiry submission confirmation.

As a venue owner, I want to track the status of my partnership inquiry so I know where I am in the process.

Gherkin scenarios cover status tracking and email updates. Acceptance criteria include inquiry status page (submitted, under review, approved, rejected), status email notifications, and estimated processing time.

As a user, I want to create a buddy list so I can assign drinks to friends during group outings.

Gherkin scenarios cover adding buddy and removing buddy. Acceptance criteria include buddy list management UI, 'Add Buddy' button, search by username/email/phone, buddy request/approval flow, buddy list display, and 'Remove Buddy' option.

summary: Assign Drinks to Buddies When Adding to Cart
description:
As a user, I want to assign drinks to buddies when adding to cart so I know who each drink is for.

Gherkin scenarios cover drink assignment and unassigned drinks. Acceptance criteria include 'Assign to' dropdown in cart, buddy list display, default to 'Me', assignment indicator per item, and reassignment option.

As a user, I want to accept or decline drinks assigned to me so I control what's added to my sobriety tracker.

Gherkin scenarios cover drink assignment notification and acceptance. Acceptance criteria include push notification on assignment, in-app notification, 'Accept' or 'Decline' buttons, acceptance deadline (5 minutes), and automatic decline on timeout.

summary: Track Assigned Drinks in Sobriety Monitor
description:
As a user, I want accepted assigned drinks to be logged in my sobriety monitor so my BAC tracking is accurate.

Gherkin scenarios cover drink logging and BAC update. Acceptance criteria include automatic logging of accepted drinks, BAC calculation update, drink history display, and drinking session update.

As a user, I want to create a group order so I can place one order for multiple people.

Gherkin scenarios cover group order creation and buddy selection. Acceptance criteria include 'Create Group Order' button, buddy selection from list, drink assignment to buddies, group order summary, and payment method selection.

As a user, I want to split payment for group orders so everyone can pay their share.

Gherkin scenarios cover split payment and payment confirmation. Acceptance criteria include payment split options (even split, by assignee, single payer), payment request notifications, individual payment processing, and group order completion after all payments.

As a user, I want to view my group order history so I can see past group outings.

Gherkin scenarios cover group order history and order details. Acceptance criteria include group order history section, group order list, order date/total/participants display, group order details (items, assignees, payments), and reorder option.

As a user, I want to receive AI-powered safety advice in real-time so I can make safer drinking decisions.

Gherkin scenarios cover safety recommendation and personalized advice. Acceptance criteria include AI Sobriety Advisor integration (Lovable AI, google/gemini-2.5-flash), real-time BAC analysis, personalized safety tips (slow down, hydrate, eat, stop drinking), context-aware advice (time of day, location, drinking pace), and in-app/push notifications.

As a user, I want to be alerted before my BAC reaches unsafe levels so I can slow down proactively.

Gherkin scenarios cover predictive alert and alert threshold. Acceptance criteria include predictive BAC calculation (based on current BAC + drinks in cart), alert thresholds (0.05%, 0.08%, 0.10%), early warning notifications (15-30 minutes before threshold), and actionable suggestions (order water, skip next drink).

As a user, I want personalized intervention strategies when my drinking becomes risky so I can regain control.

Gherkin scenarios cover intervention suggestion and escalation. Acceptance criteria include AI-generated intervention strategies (take a break, drink water, eat food, call a friend, end session), escalating interventions (based on BAC level), user response tracking (acknowledged, dismissed), and effectiveness analysis.

As a user, I want the app to alert my emergency contacts if my BAC reaches critical levels so I can get help.

Gherkin scenarios cover emergency contact alert and emergency services notification. Acceptance criteria include emergency contact setup (name, phone, relationship), critical BAC threshold (e.g., 0.15%), automatic SMS/call to emergency contacts, emergency contact message (location, BAC, alert reason), and manual emergency alert option.

As a product manager, I want to track the effectiveness of AI interventions so we can improve the system.

Acceptance criteria include intervention tracking (type, timestamp, BAC at intervention), user response tracking (acknowledged, dismissed, action taken), effectiveness metrics (BAC reduction post-intervention, session end rate), and AI model retraining based on feedback.

summary: Use Voice Commands to Add Items to Cart
description:
As a user, I want to use voice commands to add items to my cart so I can order hands-free.

Gherkin scenarios cover voice command and item confirmation. Acceptance criteria include voice activation button, speech-to-text API integration (Web Speech API, Google Speech-to-Text), natural language processing (e.g., 'Add a margarita'), item recognition and matching, voice confirmation prompt, and cart update.

summary: Use Voice Commands to Search Products
description:
As a user, I want to search for products using voice so I can find items quickly.

Gherkin scenarios cover voice search and search result display. Acceptance criteria include voice-activated search, speech-to-text conversion, keyword extraction, search result display, and 'Did you mean?' suggestions for unclear commands.

As a user, I want to confirm my order using voice so I can complete checkout hands-free.

Gherkin scenarios cover voice confirmation and voice cancellation. Acceptance criteria include order summary read aloud, 'Confirm Order' voice command, 'Cancel Order' voice command, voice authentication (optional), and order placement confirmation.

As a user, I want to navigate the app using voice commands so I can browse without touching my device.

Gherkin scenarios cover voice navigation and navigation commands. Acceptance criteria include voice commands (e.g., 'Go to Menu', 'View Cart', 'Show Rewards'), command recognition, page navigation, and command help ('What can I say?').

summary: Support Multiple Languages for Voice Commands
description:
As a user, I want to use voice commands in my preferred language so I can interact naturally.

Gherkin scenarios cover language selection and multi-language recognition. Acceptance criteria include language selection in settings, supported languages (English, Spanish, French, etc.), language-specific command recognition, and language switching.

As a user with disabilities, I want to use voice commands so I can order independently.

Acceptance criteria include accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1), voice command tutorial, visual feedback for voice commands, error correction via voice, and screen reader compatibility.

As a user with allergies, I want to set up my allergen profile so the app can warn me about unsafe products.

Gherkin scenarios cover allergen profile setup and severity selection. Acceptance criteria include allergen profile setup page, allergen selection (peanuts, shellfish, gluten, dairy, soy, eggs, tree nuts, etc.), severity levels (mild, moderate, severe), multiple allergen support, and profile saving.

As a user, I want to be warned when a product contains my allergens so I can avoid it.

Gherkin scenarios cover allergen warning display and severity-based alerts. Acceptance criteria include real-time allergen checking, warning badge on product cards, modal alert on product detail view, severity-based styling (color-coded: yellow for mild, red for severe), and 'View Alternatives' button.

summary: View Safe Alternatives to Allergen-Containing Products
description:
As a user, I want to see safe alternatives when a product contains allergens so I can still enjoy similar items.

Gherkin scenarios cover alternative suggestions and filtering. Acceptance criteria include AI-powered alternative suggestions (similar products without allergens), alternative product list, filter by category/taste profile, and 'Add to Cart' option for alternatives.

As a user, I want to be warned about cross-contamination risks so I can make fully informed decisions.

Gherkin scenarios cover cross-contamination warnings and risk levels. Acceptance criteria include cross-contamination data (prepared in same kitchen, shared equipment), risk level indicators (low, medium, high), warning display on product detail page, and venue cross-contamination policies.

As a user, I want the app to prevent me from adding allergen-containing products so I avoid accidental purchases.

Gherkin scenarios cover product blocking and override option. Acceptance criteria include automatic product blocking (based on allergen profile), block confirmation modal with reason, override option ('Add Anyway'), and override confirmation logging.

As a user, I want AI-powered venue suggestions based on my preferences so I can discover new places.

Gherkin scenarios cover personalized recommendations and occasion-based suggestions. Acceptance criteria include AI venue recommendation engine (Lovable AI, google/gemini-2.5-flash), preference learning (favorite drinks, cuisine, price range, atmosphere), personalized venue ranking, recommendation reasons ('Matches your taste', 'Popular with similar users'), and recommendation refresh.

As a user, I want venue suggestions based on occasions (date night, happy hour, etc.) so I can find the right atmosphere.

Gherkin scenarios cover occasion selection and venue filtering. Acceptance criteria include occasion selector (date night, happy hour, casual hangout, celebration, etc.), occasion-appropriate venue filtering (ambiance, price, hours), AI-powered matching, and occasion-specific recommendations.

summary: Match Venues with Social Group Preferences
description:
As a user, I want venue suggestions that match my group's preferences so everyone enjoys the outing.

Gherkin scenarios cover group preference input and consensus recommendation. Acceptance criteria include group member selection (from buddy list), preference aggregation (favorite drinks, dietary restrictions, price range), AI-powered consensus venue selection, and 'Best for Group' indicator.

As a user, I want to see real-time venue availability so I know where I can order now.

Gherkin scenarios cover availability display and reservation integration. Acceptance criteria include real-time availability status (open now, closing soon, closed), wait time estimates, reservation availability, and venue capacity indicators (busy, moderate, quiet).

As a user, I want venues ranked based on my preferences so I see the best options first.

Gherkin scenarios cover personalized ranking and ranking factors. Acceptance criteria include AI-powered venue ranking, ranking factors (preference match, distance, price, rating, availability), ranking explanation ('Top pick for you because...'), and ranking adjustments based on feedback.

summary: Coordinate Group Order Preferences with AI
description:
As a user, I want AI to help coordinate group order preferences so everyone gets what they want.

Gherkin scenarios cover preference collection and AI coordination. Acceptance criteria include group order preference collection (drink type, dietary restrictions, budget), AI-powered preference analysis (Lovable AI, google/gemini-2.5-flash), order suggestions (products that satisfy group preferences), and preference conflict identification.

As a user, I want AI to resolve conflicts in group preferences so ordering is smoother.

Gherkin scenarios cover conflict detection and resolution suggestions. Acceptance criteria include conflict detection (incompatible preferences, budget limits), AI-generated resolution suggestions (compromise options, alternative products), conflict severity scoring, and user decision support.

summary: Optimize Group Order Budget with AI
description:
As a user, I want AI to optimize our group order within a budget so we stay within spending limits.

Gherkin scenarios cover budget setting and optimization. Acceptance criteria include budget setting for group order, AI-powered budget optimization (maximize value within budget), product suggestions (best value, group favorites), and budget tracking (real-time spending).

As a user, I want AI to coordinate order timing so everyone's drinks arrive together.

Gherkin scenarios cover timing coordination and staggered orders. Acceptance criteria include order timing preferences (all at once, staggered), AI-powered timing coordination, preparation time estimation, and order submission scheduling.

summary: Ensure Dietary Accommodations in Group Orders
description:
As a user, I want AI to ensure dietary restrictions are met in group orders so everyone can enjoy safely.

Gherkin scenarios cover dietary restriction checking and allergy alerts. Acceptance criteria include dietary restriction collection (allergies, preferences), AI-powered dietary accommodation check, allergen-free product suggestions, and group dietary summary.

As a user, I want to see AI-generated insights about my spending so I can understand my habits.

Gherkin scenarios cover spending insights and spending categories. Acceptance criteria include AI spending analysis (Lovable AI, google/gemini-2.5-flash), insights generation (spending trends, patterns, peak times, average order value), spending visualization (charts, graphs), and insights refresh frequency.

As a user, I want my spending automatically categorized so I can see where my money goes.

Gherkin scenarios cover automatic categorization and category breakdown. Acceptance criteria include AI-powered spending categorization (beer, wine, spirits, food, etc.), category breakdown chart, category spending trends, category comparison (month-to-month), and manual category override.

As a user, I want to receive alerts when I'm approaching my spending budget so that I can stay within my limits.

Gherkin scenarios cover budget setting and budget alert. Acceptance criteria include budget setting (weekly, monthly), AI-powered budget tracking, budget progress display, budget threshold alerts (80%, 100%), overspending warnings, and budget recommendations.

As a user, I want to see AI predictions of my future spending so that I can plan my budget proactively.

Gherkin scenarios cover spending forecast and forecast accuracy. Acceptance criteria include AI-powered spending predictions (next week, next month), prediction based on historical data, forecast display (chart), confidence intervals, and forecast adjustments (based on upcoming events, seasonality).

As a user, I want to generate tax/expense reports from my receipts so that I can manage business expenses easily.

Gherkin scenarios cover report generation and report format. Acceptance criteria include expense report generation, date range selection, report formats (PDF, CSV), tax calculation (if applicable), receipt attachment, and email delivery.

As a user, I want to set financial goals (e.g., reduce spending by 20%) and track progress with AI so that I can improve my habits.

Gherkin scenarios cover goal setting and goal tracking. Acceptance criteria include financial goal setting (spending reduction, savings, frequency reduction), AI-powered progress tracking, goal progress display (progress bar), goal achievement notifications, and AI-generated tips for goal achievement.
